summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no direct mention of Harold E. Ford. The documents primarily concern the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) final determination notifications regarding the release of HSCA (House Select Committee on Assassinations) staff payroll records. These notifications often involve postponing the release of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. The documents also include payroll records, personnel records, and correspondence related to HSCA staff members. The HSCA was involved in investigating the JFK assassination, and these documents shed light on the administrative and personnel aspects of the committee's operations.
significance: Without direct mention in the documents, the significance of Harold E. Ford in the JFK context cannot be determined from the provided information. The documents focus on the administrative aspects of the HSCA and the ARRB's decisions regarding the release of personnel information.
